title: Can I do well in the SAT with 1 month of studying? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on several factors. I increased my SAT score by 90 points through one month’s studying. These are the guidelines I followed. What’s your starting place? If you took challenging math and English courses during the school year, you’re already better prepared and will have an easier time studying. If you didn’t do the stuff on the test in class, you need to work more at trying to understand the methods.How hard are you willing to work? It’s going to take many hours to achieve your SAT goals. Create a study plan and stick to it.Study smart. Don’t start out with doing just random practice problems. If you’re using the textbook, find chapters with content you haven’t mastered yet and read the instructions for how to solve different problems. Then do practice problems.On my first SAT, I had a reading score I was happy with and a math score I was not. I got the Kaplan book and went through each math chapter, reading through the methods and problem-solving skills and then doing the related problems. Each chapter took me 1–3 hours and there were 8 chapters. It was a lot, but it was doable. I set a goal of one chapter every 2 days. I sometimes fell short, but ultimately finished before the SAT and achieved my goal. And you can too.

YES, doable - though ideal time is three month’s schedule. You need just about 100 hours to complete SAT preparation and ace well the SAT test. You can conclude SAT preparation by taking SAT Official practices tests, published by College Board, one by one and try completing all of them. This gives you practice to remain concentrated for full exam duration.Practice makes you perfect. Take the most recent one, answer as if you are doing in a test center and within the prescribed time. Evaluate your answers, you have scoring sheet and also explanations to answers available. Review all wrong / guessed questions and understand how you can get them right next time. Adopt this iterative approach, until you complete all official tests and will definitely improve your overall score.
You can, but it likely won’t be your best score. 4–6 months is optimal.
